content:
EntitySet<TEntity> Class

Definition

Provides for deferred loading and relationship maintenance for the collection side of one-to-many and one-to-one relationships in a LINQ to SQL applications.

In this Article

public sealed class EntitySet<TEntity> : System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<TEntity>, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<TEntity>, System.Collections.Generic.IList<TEntity>, System.Collections.IList, System.ComponentModel.IListSource where TEntity : class

Type Parameters

TEntity

The data type of the target entity.
Inheritance
System.Object
EntitySet<TEntity>

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

This class is used in combination with EntityRef<TEntity>.

Constructors

EntitySet<TEntity>()

Initializes a new instance of the stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1 class.

public EntitySet ();

EntitySet<TEntity>(Action<TEntity>,Action<TEntity>)

Initializes a new instance of the stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1 class while supplying handlers for add and remove operations.

public EntitySet (Action<TEntity> onAdd, Action<TEntity> onRemove);
onAdd
Action<TEntity>

Delegate for stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1.Add*.

onRemove
Action<TEntity>

Delegate for stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1.Remove*.

Properties

Count

Gets the number of entities in the stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1 collection.

public int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

An integer representing the number of entities.

HasLoadedOrAssignedValues

Specifies whether the stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1 has loaded or assigned a value.

public bool HasLoadedOrAssignedValues { get; }
Value
Boolean

Returns true if the stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1 has either loaded or assigned a value.

Remarks

"Loaded" means that the data was loaded during materialization or at deferred loading. "Assigned" means that you have manually given the data a value.

IsDeferred

Specifies whether this stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1 has a deferred query that has not yet executed.

public bool IsDeferred { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if a deferred query has not yet been executed; otherwise false.

Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the element at the specified index.

public TEntity this[int index] { get; set; }
index
Int32

The index of the element.

Value
TEntity

An stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1 representing the item.

Methods

Add(TEntity)

Adds an entity.

public void Add (TEntity entity);
entity
TEntity

The entity to add.

AddRange(IEnumerable<TEntity>)

Adds a collection of entities.

public void AddRange (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<TEntity> collection);
collection
IEnumerable<TEntity>

The collection to be added.

Assign(IEnumerable<TEntity>)

Assigns an stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1 collection to another stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1 collection.

public void Assign (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<TEntity> entitySource);
entitySource
IEnumerable<TEntity>

The collection to assign.

Clear()

Removes all items.

public void Clear ();

Contains(TEntity)

Specifies whether the stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1 contains a specific entity.

public bool Contains (TEntity entity);
entity
TEntity

The entity.

Returns
Boolean

true if the stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1 contains the entity; otherwise, false.

CopyTo(TEntity[],Int32)

Copies the stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1 to an array.

public void CopyTo (TEntity[] array, int arrayIndex);
array
TEntity[][]

The array to copy to.

arrayIndex
Int32

The starting index in the array.

Remarks

The following C# sample shows one use of this method: 

var customer = (from c in db.Customers  
   where c.CustomerID == "ALFKI"  
   select c).Single();  

Order[] orderArray = new Order[customer.Orders.Count];

customer.Orders.CopyTo(orderArray,0);In Visual Basic: 

Dim customer = (From c In db.Customers _   
   Where c.CustomerID = "ALFKI" _   
   Select c).[Single]()  

Dim orderArray As Order() = New Order(customer.Orders.Count - 1) {}  
customer.Orders.CopyTo(orderArray, 0)

GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection.

public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator<TEntity> GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator<TEntity>

An stem.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1.

Returns
IBindingList

A new IBindingList for binding to a data source.

TEntity

Returns
Int32

An integer representing the index.

Inserts an entity at an index position.

index
Int32

The index representing the position at which to insert the entity.

entity
TEntity

The entity to be inserted.

Load()

Loads the stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1.

public void Load ();

Removes an entity.

public bool Remove (TEntity entity);
entity
TEntity

The entity to be removed.

Returns
Boolean

true if the entity is successfully removed; otherwise, false.

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes an entity at a specified index.

public void RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The index of the entity to be removed.

SetSource(IEnumerable<TEntity>)

Sets the source of the stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1.

public void SetSource (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<TEntity> entitySource);
entitySource
IEnumerable<TEntity>

The source of the stem.Data.Linq.EntitySet`1.

Occurs when the contents of a list are changed.

public event System.ComponentModel.ListChangedEventHandler ListChanged;
